title: SKPaint.BreakText returns wrong number of characters for special unicode characters
body:
Hi matthew,

i noticed that the BreakText method returns the wrong number of character for special unicode characters like german umlaute. 
Some examples:
```
paint.TextEncoding = SKTextEncoding.Utf8;
paint.BreakText("ä", 50.0f); => returns 2
paint.BreakText("a", 50.0f); => returns 1

paint.TextEncoding = SKTextEncoding.Utf16;
paint.BreakText("ä", 50.0f); => returns 2
paint.BreakText("a", 50.0f); => returns 2

paint.TextEncoding = SKTextEncoding.Utf32;
paint.BreakText("ä", 50.0f); => returns 4
paint.BreakText("a", 50.0f); => returns 4
```

Best regards
Fred

comments.author: iseesharp83
comments.body: Running into this exact same problem ... why is this?

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
Hi @bay0fred and @brazilianldsjaguar. This is directly a result of me writing incorrect documentation, and as a result of that, I did not properly tweak the return value.

The return value is actually the NUMBER OF BYTES in the string, that is why you see the larger numbers.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: I will investigate the best way to adjust this.
